item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Harry Harrison
item.description: "Every day should be unwrapped as a gift." -- Harry Harrison

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description:
"Libraries should be open to all - except the censor.
<i>[Response to questionnaire in Saturday Review, October 29 1960]</i>" -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description:
"Those who make peaceful revolution impossible will make violent revolution inevitable."
[<i>Remarks on the first anniversary of the Alliance for Progress</i>, 13 March 1962]" -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "We must find time to stop and thank the people who make a difference in our lives." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Paul Newman
item.description: "A man with no enemies is a man with no character." -- Paul Newman

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Paul Newman
item.description: "We are such spendthrifts with our lives, the trick of living is to slip on and off the planet with the least fuss you can muster. Iâ€™m not running for sainthood. I just happen to think that in life we need to be a little like the farmer, who puts back into the soil what he takes out." -- Paul Newman

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "When you get to the end of your rope. Tie a knot and hang on." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Rodney Dangerfield
item.description: "I came from a real tough neighborhood. Once a guy pulled a knife on me. I knew he wasn't a professional, the knife had butter on it." -- Rodney Dangerfield

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Jerry Seinfeld
item.description: "If a book about failures doesn't sell, is it a success?" -- Jerry Seinfeld

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Rodney Dangerfield
item.description: "Once I pulled a job, I was so stupid. I picked a guy's pocket on an airplane and made a run for it." -- Rodney Dangerfield

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "If the events of September 11, 2001, have proven anything, it's that the terrorists can attack us, but they can't take away what makes us American -- our freedom, our liberty, our civil rights. No, only Attorney General John Ashcroft can do that." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I did not attend his funeral, but I sent a nice letter saying I approved of it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Everything you can imagine is real." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "War is what happens when language fails." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "All war is a symptom of man's failure as a thinking animal." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Herbert Hoover
item.description: "Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die." -- Herbert Hoover

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "When the rich wage war it's the poor who die." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "God created war so that Americans would learn geography." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Benjamin add a quote by George Steiner
item.description: "We know now that a man can read Goethe or Rilke in the evening, that he can play Bach and Schubert, and go to his day's work at Auschwitz in the morning." -- George Steiner
